label: NON_COMPLIANT
segment: If you wish to make a request regarding your personal information, please note that requests submitted electronically will be responded to electronically where possible, unless you specify another method. If we are unable to act on your request, you will be notified within one month, including reasons and information about how to seek further remedies. If your request is manifestly unfounded or excessive, we may refuse to act. Where we have doubts about your identity, we may ask you for more information to confirm your identity.

Where data was not collected directly from you, we will share any available information about its source. You are entitled to receive a copy of your personal data undergoing processing; additional copies may incur a reasonable fee based on administrative costs. Providing copies will not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

Data subjects can exercise their rights through established complaint procedures, and our appointed data protection officer monitors compliance, training, and complaint resolution. Regular verification of compliance occurs, and outcomes are reported to relevant oversight bodies within our group and made available to authorities upon request. These rules are adopted following established procedures to ensure consistency and oversight within our group’s activities.

Decisions on adequacy are publicly available and adopted according to established EU procedures. Previous adequacy decisions remain effective unless amended, replaced, or repealed by the Commission. For more information about current adequacy decisions, please consult the Official Journal of the European Union or the Commission’s website.

You have rights to access, rectify, erase, restrict, or port your data, and to object or withdraw consent at any time. You may lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. label: NON_COMPLIANT
segment: We collect only the amount of personal data necessary for our stated purposes and implement technical and organisational measures, including pseudonymisation, to protect your information. label: NON_COMPLIANT

Such transfers do not require specific authorisation, and we consider relevant legislation in the destination country, including public security and criminal law, as well as the rule of law. We monitor developments in these countries and sectors to ensure continued adequacy of protection and note that decisions regarding adequacy are periodically reviewed by the appropriate authorities. However, we do not guarantee that all such destinations have been formally recognised as providing an adequate level of protection, nor do we ensure the existence of independent supervisory authorities or effective redress mechanisms for data subjects. Our policy does not explicitly address respect for fundamental rights, enforceable data subject rights, or the presence of binding international commitments. Please be aware that, in some cases, your data may be subject to differing standards of protection.

label: COMPLIANT

label: COMPLIANT

If we intend to process your data for new purposes, you will be informed beforehand.

label: NON_COMPLIANT

label: NON_COMPLIANT

label: COMPLIANT

In making its adequacy decisions, the Commission considers factors such as the rule of law, relevant legislation (including those governing public security, defence, and criminal law), the effectiveness of data subject rights, access to administrative and judicial redress, the presence and functioning of independent supervisory authorities, and the international commitments undertaken by the destination country or organisation. The Commission continuously monitors developments in these countries and may amend or suspend adequacy decisions to ensure ongoing protection. Decisions previously made under former data protection frameworks remain in force unless replaced or repealed.
